page.title: 13CHICKEN FARM NEAR NESSCLIFFE
page.content: We went to the chicken farm at Valeswood and saw hundreds and thousands of chicks. They were fed automatically by a machine that goes round with chick food so they can peck food out of it. There are lights and heaters to keep them warm too. There was water for them. There were four sheds each big enough to hold 25OO chicks. The chicks come from Craven Arms on the day they hatch. They stay on the farm for 4O days. They grow very fast. Then they are sent back to Craven Arms where they are killed and frosen. If the chickens escape or the food stops going round an alarm goes off. The farm has been there for l8 years, 4 people work on the farm which I think is not very many.
